tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE intrusion_detection_system (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    activity_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE IntrusionEvents (
  event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  event_time TIMESTAMP,
  event_description TEXT,
  event_source VARCHAR,
  event_user VARCHAR
)

CREATE TABLE SuspiciousActivities (
  activity_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  activity_type VARCHAR,
  activity_description TEXT,
  activity_time TIMESTAMP,
  activity_user VARCHAR
)

CREATE TABLE AlertLog (
  alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  alert_time TIMESTAMP,
  alert_type VARCHAR,
  alert_description TEXT,
  alert_user VARCHAR
)

CREATE TABLE intrusion_events (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_type VARCHAR(50),
    event_description TEXT,
    event_time TIMESTAMP,
    event_source_ip VARCHAR(15),
    event_user VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE intrusion_alerts (
    alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    alert_type VARCHAR(50),
    alert_description TEXT,
    alert_time TIMESTAMP,
    alert_severity INT,
    alert_status VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE intrusion_devices (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(50),
    device_type VARCHAR(50),
    device_location VARCHAR(100),
    device_status VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE users (
  user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  username VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
  password VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE,
  role VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE activities (
  activity_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT,
  activity_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  activity_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id)
);

CREATE TABLE suspicious_activities (
  activity_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT,
  activity_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  activity_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  severity INT NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id)
);
